title: Swagger Petstore
description: This is a sample server Petstore server.  You can find out more about Swagger at [http://swagger.io](http://swagger.io) or on [irc.freenode.net, #swagger](http://swagger.io/irc/).  For this sample, you can use the api key `special-key` to test the authorization filters.

methods.title: Add a new pet to the store
Updates a pet in the store with form data
Place an order for a pet
Creates list of users with given input array
Creates list of users with given input array
Logs out current logged in user session

methods.title: Add a new pet to the store
Finds Pets by status

request.description: Multiple status values can be provided with comma separated strings

methods.description: Multiple status values can be provided with comma separated strings

query.name: status
query.description: Status values that need to be considered for filter

methods.title: Finds Pets by tags

request.description: Muliple tags can be provided with comma separated strings. Use tag1, tag2, tag3 for testing.

methods.description: Muliple tags can be provided with comma separated strings. Use tag1, tag2, tag3 for testing.

path.name: petId
path.description: ID of pet that needs to be updated

methods.title: Returns pet inventories by status

request.description: Returns a map of status codes to quantities

methods.description: Returns a map of status codes to quantities

methods.title: Place an order for a pet
Find purchase order by ID

request.description: For valid response try integer IDs with value >= 1 and <= 10. Other values will generated exceptions

methods.description: For valid response try integer IDs with value >= 1 and <= 10. Other values will generated exceptions

path.name: orderId
path.description: ID of pet that needs to be fetched

methods.title: Delete purchase order by ID

request.description: For valid response try integer IDs with positive integer value. Negative or non-integer values will generate API errors

methods.description: For valid response try integer IDs with positive integer value. Negative or non-integer values will generate API errors

path.name: orderId
path.description: ID of the order that needs to be deleted
